title: Electrolyte for lithium secondary battery and lithium secondary battery including the same

events.title: Application filed by Samsung Electronics Co Ltd

classifications.description: Rocking-chair batteries, i.e. batteries with lithium insertion or intercalation in both electrodes; Lithium-ion batteries
Liquid materials characterised by the additives
Liquid materials characterised by the solutes
Liquid materials characterised by the solvents
Electrodes for accumulators with non-aqueous electrolyte, e.g. for lithium-accumulators; Processes of manufacture thereof
Selection of substances as active materials, active masses, active liquids

Selection of substances as active materials, active masses, active liquids of inorganic oxides or hydroxides of manganese of mixed oxides or hydroxides containing manganese for inserting or intercalating light metals, e.g. LiMn2O4 or LiMn2OxFy

Selection of substances as active materials, active masses, active liquids of inorganic oxides or hydroxides of nickel, cobalt or iron of mixed oxides or hydroxides containing iron, cobalt or nickel for inserting or intercalating light metals, e.g. LiNiO2, LiCoO2 or LiCoOxFy
Energy storage systems for electromobility, e.g. batteries

abstract: An electrolyte for a lithium secondary battery, the electrolyte including a lithium salt, a non-aqueous organic solvent, and a polar additive based on a substituted heterobicyclic compound. Oxidation of the electrolyte is prevented by formation of a polar thin film on a surface portion of the positive electrode, which facilitates transfer of lithium ions. The lithium secondary batteries using the electrolyte have excellent high temperature life characteristics and high temperature conservation characteristics.
claims:
An electrolyte for a lithium secondary battery, the electrolyte comprising a lithium salt, a non-aqueous organic solvent, and an additive represented by Formula 1 below:

CY1 is a C3-C6 aromatic ring, and CY2 is a C3-C5 aromatic or non-aromatic ring;
B1 and B2 are each independently a single bond,
  
or a C1-C5 alkylene group; and
R1 and R2 are each independently hydrogen, a halogen group, a cyano group, a hydroxyl group, -C(=O)Ra, -C(=O)ORa, -OCO(ORa), -C=N(Ra), -SRa, -S(=O)Ra, - S(=O)2Ra, -PRa, a substituted or unsubstituted C1-C20 alkyl group, a substituted or unsubstituted C1-C20 alkoxy group, a substituted or unsubstituted C2-C20 alkenyl group, a substituted or unsubstituted C2-C20 alkynyl group, a C2-C20 alkylene oxide group, a substituted or unsubstituted C3-C30 cycloalkyl group, a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 aryl group, a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 aryloxy group, a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 heteroaryl group, or combinations thereof, wherein Ra is hydrogen, a C1-C10 alkyl group, or a C6-C20 aryl group,
with the proviso that at least one of R1 and R2 includes a polar functional group selected from the group consisting of a halogen group, a hydroxyl group, -C(=O)Ra, -C(=O)ORa, - OCO(ORa), C=N(Ra), -SRa, -PRa, a substituted or unsubstituted C1-C20 alkoxy group, a C2-C20 alkylene oxide group, a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 aryloxy group, and a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 heteroaryl group.

The electrolyte of claim 1, wherein the additive is represented by Formula 2 below:
  
wherein A1 and A2 are each, independently:
  
or
  
with the proviso that A1 and A2 include at least one of
  
and
  
B3 and B4 are each independently a single bond,
  
or a C1-C5 alkylene group; and
R'1, R"1, R"2, R"3, and R"4 are each independently hydrogen, a halogen group, a hydroxyl group, a cyano group, -C(=O)Ra, -C(=O)ORa, -OCO(ORa), -C=N(Ra), -SRa, - S(=O)Ra, -S(=O)2Ra, -PRa, a substituted or unsubstituted C1-C20 alkyl group, a substituted or unsubstituted C1-C20 alkoxy group, a substituted or unsubstituted C2-C20 alkenyl group, a substituted or unsubstituted C2-C20 alkynyl group, a C2-C20 alkylene oxide group, a substituted or unsubstituted C3-C30 cycloalkyl group, a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 aryl group, a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 aryloxy group, a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 heteroaryl group, or a combination thereof, wherein Ra is hydrogen, a C1-C10 alkyl group, or a C6-C20 aryl group,
with the proviso that at least one of R'1, R"1, R"2, R"3, and R"4 includes a polar functional group selected from the group consisting of a halogen group, a hydroxyl group, - C(=O)Ra, -C(=O)ORa, -OCO(ORa), C=N(Ra), -SRa, -PRa, a substituted or unsubstituted C1-C20 alkoxy group, a C2-C20 alkylene oxide group, a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 aryloxy group, and a substituted or unsubstituted C6-C30 heteroaryl group.

The electrolyte of claim 1, wherein the additive is at least one compound selected from the group consisting of:
  
  
  
  
and
The electrolyte of claim 1, wherein the additive is at least one compound selected from the group consisting of:
The electrolyte of claim 1, wherein the additive is at least one compound selected from the group consisting of
The electrolyte of any of claims 1-5, wherein the amount of the additive is in a range of about 0.005 to about 10 wt% based on the total weight of the electrolyte.
The electrolyte of claim 6, wherein the amount of the additive is in a range of about 0.01 to about 5 wt% based on the total weight of the electrolyte.

The electrolyte of any of claims 1-7, wherein the lithium salt is one compound selected from LiPF6, LiBF4, LiSbF6, LiAsF6, LiCF3S03, Li(CF3SO2)3C, Li(CF3SO2)2N, LiC4F9SO3, LiCl04, LiAlO4, LiAlCl4, LiBPh4, LiN(CxF2x+1SO2)(CxF2y+1SO2) where x and y are natural numbers, LiCl, Lil, lithium bisoxalate borate (LIBOB), and combinations thereof.

The electrolyte of any of claims 1-8, wherein the non-aqueous organic solvent is a carbonate-based solvent, an ester-based solvent, an ether-based solvent, a ketone-based solvent, an alcohol-based solvent, a non-protonic solvent, or combinations thereof.

A lithium secondary battery comprising:
a positive electrode comprising a positive active material into or from which lithium ions are intercalated or deintercalated;
a negative electrode comprising a negative active material into or from which lithium ions are intercalated or deintercalated; and
an electrolyte interposed between the positive electrode and the negative electrode,
wherein the electrolyte is an electrolyte according to any of claims 1-9.
The lithium secondary battery of claim 10, wherein the positive electrode comprises a film formed on its surface, wherein the film is partially or fully derived from the additive in the electrolyte.
The lithium secondary battery of claim 11, wherein the thickness of the film is in a range of about 0.5 nm to about 100 nm.
The lithium secondary battery of any of claims 10-12, wherein the positive active material is Li1+x(M)1-xO2, 0.05≤x≤0.2 and M is a transition metal.
The lithium secondary battery of any of claims 10-13, wherein the positive active material has an operating potential of 4.5 V ± 0.5 V.

The lithium secondary battery of any of claims 10-14, wherein the negative active material is at least one material from the group vanadium oxide, lithium vanadium oxide, Si, SiOx where 0 < x < 2, Si-T alloys where T is Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba, Sc, Y, Ti, Zr, Hf, V, Nb, Ta, Cr, Mo, W, Re, Fe, Pb, Ru, Os, Rh, Ir, Pd, Pt, Cu, Ag, Au, Zn, Cd, B, Al, Ga, Sn, In, Ti, Ge, P, As, Sb, Bi, S, Se, Te, or combinations thereof, graphite, soft carbon, hard carbon, meso-phase pitch carbide, and calcined coke.
